body: Yes, it seemed easier that way because we don't really have a mechanism to track whether something shouldn't be refcounted (besides retain in the TensorImpl constructor, but that isn't maintained across copies).
body_html: Yes, it seemed easier that way because we don't really have a mechanism to track whether something shouldn't be refcounted (besides retain in the TensorImpl constructor, but that isn't maintained across copies).
body_text: Yes, it seemed easier that way because we don't really have a mechanism to track whether something shouldn't be refcounted (besides retain in the TensorImpl constructor, but that isn't maintained across copies).
